meanings.definition: A practical joke or mischievous act.
meanings.sent1: The prankster pulled a funny pranked on his friend.
meanings.sent2: The class clown always had the best pranked up his sleeve.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party was full of laughter after the hilarious pranked played on the guest of honor.
meanings.sent4: The prank war between siblings escalated when a particularly elaborate pranked was executed.
meanings.sent5: The famous magician's pranked left the audience in awe and disbelief.

meanings.definition: To play a trick or practical joke on someone.
meanings.sent1: She pranked her brother by hiding his favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: The friends decided to prank their teacher by switching his coffee with juice.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat pranked its owner by hiding all the socks in the house.
meanings.sent4: He pranked his roommate by filling his room with balloons while he was asleep.
meanings.sent5: The kids pranked their dad by putting salt in the sugar bowl, causing a funny mix-up during breakfast.
